div1.p: Howard inquires about the whereabouts of the mosquitoes Lazear sent up from Cuba. [Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration]

div1.head: Letter from L. O. Howard to Walter Reed, April 19, 1900
div1.p:
I accidentally met Mrs. Lazear on the train last evening and
she asked me whether I had received a collection of mosquitoes which
her husband, Dr. Lazear, had sent up from Cuba by you. I told her I
had not seen them and that I did not know you had returned. She told
me, however, that you probably reached Washington two weeks ago, and
I am therefore sending a messenger over with this to you in order pos-
sibly to save you the trouble of sending your own messenger to me with
the mosquitoes. I trust you have returned home in excellent physi-
cal condition and hope to see you some of these days.
div1.closer:
Yours most truly, L.O. Howard
Dr. Walter Reed,
U.S. Army Medical Museum.
